verses.kjv: In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah began Hoshea the son of Elah to reign in Samaria over Israel nine years.
verses.web: In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah, Hoshea the son of Elah began to reign in Samaria over Israel for nine years.
verses.ct: Hoshea son of Elah became king of Israel in Samaria during the 12th year of King Ahaz of Judah's reign. He ruled for 9 years.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, but not as the kings of Israel that were before him.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, yet not as the kings of Israel who were before him.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil, though not as bad as the kings of Israel who came before him.

verses.kjv: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant, and gave him presents.
verses.web: Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against him, and Hoshea became his servant, and brought him tribute.
verses.ct: King Shalmaneser of Assyria attacked him, and Hoshea surrendered, becoming his subject and paying him tribute.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea: for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt, and brought no present to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.
verses.web: The king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea; for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt, and offered no tribute to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year. Therefore the king of Assyria seized him, and bound him in prison.
verses.ct: But the king of Assyria discovered that Hoshea was plotting against him — he had secretly sent messengers to King So of Egypt and had stopped paying the annual tribute to Assyria. So the king of Assyria arrested Hoshea and threw him in prison.

verses.kjv: Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, and went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.
verses.web: Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.
verses.ct: Then the king of Assyria invaded the entire land, marched on Samaria, and laid siege to it for 3 years.

verses.kjv: In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria, and carried Israel away into Assyria, and placed them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.
verses.web: In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria, and carried Israel away to Assyria, and placed them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.
verses.ct: In the 9th year of Hoshea's reign, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and deported the people of Israel to Assyria. He settled them in Halah, along the Habor River in the region of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

verses.kjv: For so it was, that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God, which had brought them up out of the land of Egypt, from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and had feared other gods,
verses.web: It was so because the children of Israel had sinned against LORD their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and had feared other gods,
verses.ct: All of this happened because the people of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God — the same God who had rescued them from Egypt and freed them from Pharaoh's grip. They had chosen to fear other gods instead,

verses.kjv: And walked in the statutes of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they had made.
verses.web: and walked in the statutes of the nations whom LORD cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they made.
verses.ct: and they adopted the customs of the nations the LORD had driven out before them. They also followed the corrupt practices introduced by their own kings.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel did secretly those things that were not right against the LORD their God, and they built them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.
verses.web: The children of Israel secretly did things that were not right against LORD their God; and they built high places for themselves in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city;
verses.ct: The people of Israel did things in secret that offended the LORD their God. They built pagan shrines in every town, from the smallest watchtower outpost to the largest fortified city.

verses.kjv: And they set them up images and groves in every high hill, and under every green tree:
verses.web: and they set up for themselves pillars and Asherah poles on every high hill, and under every green tree;
verses.ct: They set up sacred pillars and Asherah poles on every hilltop and under every green tree.

verses.kjv: And there they burnt incense in all the high places, as did the heathen whom the LORD carried away before them; and wrought wicked things to provoke the LORD to anger:
verses.web: and there they burned incense in all the high places, as the nations whom LORD carried away before them did; and they did wicked things to provoke LORD to anger;
verses.ct: At all these shrines they burned incense, just like the nations the LORD had driven out before them. They did wicked things that provoked the LORD to anger.

verses.kjv: For they served idols, whereof the LORD had said unto them, Ye shall not do this thing.
verses.web: and they served idols, of which LORD had said to them, “You shall not do this thing.”
verses.ct: They worshiped idols — the very thing the LORD had explicitly told them never to do.

verses.kjv: Yet the LORD testified against Israel, and against Judah, by all the prophets, and by all the seers, saying, Turn ye from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.
verses.web: Yet LORD testified to Israel, and to Judah, by every prophet, and every seer, saying, “Turn from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.”
verses.ct: The LORD had warned Israel and Judah through every prophet and every seer, saying, "Turn away from your evil ways. Keep my commandments and my statutes — the entire law I gave your ancestors and sent to you through my servants the prophets."

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding they would not hear, but hardened their necks, like to the neck of their fathers, that did not believe in the LORD their God.
verses.web: Notwithstanding, they would not listen, but hardened their neck, like the neck of their fathers, who didn’t believe in LORD their God.
verses.ct: But they refused to listen. They were as stubborn as their ancestors had been — people who didn't believe in the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: And they rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified against them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and went after the heathen that were round about them, concerning whom the LORD had charged them, that they should not do like them.
verses.web: They rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified to them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and followed the nations that were around them, concerning whom LORD had commanded them that they should not do like them.
verses.ct: They rejected his statutes, the covenant he had made with their ancestors, and the warnings he had given them. They chased after worthless idols and became worthless themselves. They imitated the surrounding nations — the very thing the LORD had commanded them not to do.

verses.kjv: And they left all the commandments of the LORD their God, and made them molten images, even two calves, and made a grove, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served Baal.
verses.web: They abandoned all the commandments of LORD their God, and made molten images for themselves, even two calves, and made an Asherah, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served Baal.
verses.ct: They abandoned every commandment of the LORD their God. They cast two metal calves for themselves, set up an Asherah pole, worshiped the stars in the sky, and served Baal.

verses.kjv: And they caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, and used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
verses.web: They caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do that which was evil in LORD’s sight, to provoke him to anger.
verses.ct: They sacrificed their own sons and daughters in fire, practiced divination and sorcery, and completely gave themselves over to doing what the LORD saw as evil, provoking him to anger.

verses.kjv: Therefore the LORD was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.
verses.web: Therefore LORD was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight. There was none left but the tribe of Judah only.
verses.ct: So the LORD burned with anger against Israel and banished them from his presence. Only the tribe of Judah remained.

verses.kjv: Also Judah kept not the commandments of the LORD their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
verses.web: Also Judah didn’t keep the commandments of LORD their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
verses.ct: Even Judah didn't keep the commandments of the LORD their God. They followed the same corrupt practices that Israel had introduced.

verses.kjv: And the LORD rejected all the seed of Israel, and afflicted them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast them out of his sight.
verses.web: LORD rejected all the offspring of Israel, afflicted them, and delivered them into the hands of raiders, until he had cast them out of his sight.
verses.ct: The LORD rejected all the descendants of Israel. He punished them and handed them over to raiders who plundered them, until finally he cast them out of his presence entirely.

verses.kjv: For he rent Israel from the house of David; and they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king: and Jeroboam drave Israel from following the LORD, and made them sin a great sin.
verses.web: For he tore Israel from David’s house; and they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king; and Jeroboam drove Israel from following LORD, and made them sin a great sin.
verses.ct: Long before, God had torn Israel away from the house of David, and the people had made Jeroboam son of Nebat their king. Jeroboam led Israel away from following the LORD and caused them to commit a terrible sin.

verses.kjv: For the children of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did; they departed not from them;
verses.web: The children of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did; they didn’t depart from them
verses.ct: The people of Israel continued in every sin that Jeroboam had committed. They never turned away from them,

verses.kjv: Until the LORD removed Israel out of his sight, as he had said by all his servants the prophets. So was Israel carried away out of their own land to Assyria unto this day.
verses.web: until LORD removed Israel out of his sight, as he said by all his servants the prophets. So Israel was carried away out of their own land to Assyria to this day.
verses.ct: until the LORD finally removed Israel from his presence, just as he had warned through all his servants the prophets. So Israel was carried away from their homeland to Assyria, where they remain to this day.

verses.kjv: And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, and from Cuthah, and from Ava, and from Hamath, and from Sepharvaim, and placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the children of Israel: and they possessed Samaria, and dwelt in the cities thereof.
verses.web: The king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, from Cuthah, from Avva, and from Hamath and Sepharvaim, and placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the children of Israel; and they possessed Samaria, and lived in its cities.
verses.ct: The king of Assyria brought people from Babylon, Cuthah, Avva, Hamath, and Sepharvaim and settled them in the cities of Samaria to replace the Israelites. These foreigners took possession of Samaria and lived in its towns.

verses.kjv: And so it was at the beginning of their dwelling there, that they feared not the LORD: therefore the LORD sent lions among them, which slew some of them.
verses.web: So it was, at the beginning of their dwelling there, that they didn’t fear LORD. Therefore LORD sent lions among them, which killed some of them.
verses.ct: When they first settled there, they did not fear the LORD. So the LORD sent lions among them, and the lions killed some of them.

verses.kjv: Wherefore they spake to the king of Assyria, saying, The nations which thou hast removed, and placed in the cities of Samaria, know not the manner of the God of the land: therefore he hath sent lions among them, and, behold, they slay them, because they know not the manner of the God of the land.
verses.web: Therefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, “The nations which you have carried away and placed in the cities of Samaria don’t know the law of the god of the land. Therefore he has sent lions among them, and behold, they kill them, because they don’t know the law of the god of the land.”
verses.ct: A report was sent to the king of Assyria: "The people you deported and resettled in the cities of Samaria don't know the requirements of the God of that land. So he has sent lions among them, and the lions are killing them because they don't know what the God of the land requires."

verses.kjv: Then the king of Assyria commanded, saying, Carry thither one of the priests whom ye brought from thence; and let them go and dwell there, and let him teach them the manner of the God of the land.
verses.web: Then the king of Assyria commanded, saying, “Carry there one of the priests whom you brought from there; and let them go and dwell there, and let him teach them the law of the god of the land.”
verses.ct: The king of Assyria gave this order: "Send back one of the priests you brought from there. Have him go and live there and teach the people the requirements of the God of the land."

verses.kjv: Then one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and dwelt in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear the LORD.
verses.web: So one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and lived in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear LORD.
verses.ct: So one of the priests who had been deported from Samaria came and settled in Bethel, and he taught the people how to fear the LORD.

verses.kjv: Howbeit every nation made gods of their own, and put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities wherein they dwelt.
verses.web: However every nation made gods of their own, and put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities in which they lived.
verses.ct: Even so, each national group continued making its own gods and setting them up in the shrine buildings the Samaritans had built. Every group did this in the towns where they lived.

verses.kjv: And the men of Babylon made Succothbenoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,
verses.web: The men of Babylon made Succoth Benoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,
verses.ct: The people from Babylon made Succoth Benoth, the people from Cuthah made Nergal, and the people from Hamath made Ashima.

verses.kjv: And the Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burnt their children in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.
verses.web: and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak; and the Sepharvites burned their children in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.
verses.ct: The Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burned their children in fire as sacrifices to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

verses.kjv: So they feared the LORD, and made unto themselves of the lowest of them priests of the high places, which sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.
verses.web: So they feared LORD, and also made from among themselves priests of the high places for themselves, who sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.
verses.ct: They also feared the LORD, but they appointed all sorts of people from among themselves as priests for the hilltop shrines, and these priests offered sacrifices on their behalf.

verses.kjv: They feared the LORD, and served their own gods, after the manner of the nations whom they carried away from thence.
verses.web: They feared LORD, and also served their own gods, after the ways of the nations from among whom they had been carried away.
verses.ct: So they feared the LORD while also serving their own gods, following the customs of the nations they had come from.

verses.kjv: Unto this day they do after the former manners: they fear not the LORD, neither do they after their statutes, or after their ordinances, or after the law and commandment which the LORD commanded the children of Jacob, whom he named Israel;
verses.web: To this day they do what they did before. They don’t fear LORD, and they do not follow the statutes, or the ordinances, or the law, or the commandment which LORD commanded the children of Jacob, whom he named Israel;
verses.ct: To this day they continue their old practices. They don't truly fear the LORD, and they don't follow the statutes, the ordinances, the law, or the commandments that the LORD gave to the descendants of Jacob — the man he renamed Israel.

verses.kjv: With whom the LORD had made a covenant, and charged them, saying, Ye shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them:
verses.web: with whom LORD had made a covenant, and commanded them, saying, “You shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them;
verses.ct: The LORD had made a covenant with them and commanded them: "You must not fear other gods or bow down to them or serve them or sacrifice to them.

verses.kjv: But the LORD, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and a stretched out arm, him shall ye fear, and him shall ye worship, and to him shall ye do sacrifice.
verses.web: but you shall fear LORD, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and with an outstretched arm, and you shall bow yourselves to him, and you shall sacrifice to him.
verses.ct: Instead, fear the LORD, who brought you out of Egypt with great power and an outstretched arm. Worship him and offer your sacrifices to him.

verses.kjv: And the statutes, and the ordinances, and the law, and the commandment, which he wrote for you, ye shall observe to do for evermore; and ye shall not fear other gods.
verses.web: The statutes and the ordinances, and the law and the commandment, which he wrote for you, you shall observe to do forever more. You shall not fear other gods.
verses.ct: Carefully obey the statutes, the ordinances, the law, and the commandments he wrote for you. Do this forever. Do not fear other gods.

verses.kjv: And the covenant that I have made with you ye shall not forget; neither shall ye fear other gods.
verses.web: You shall not forget the covenant that I have made with you. You shall not fear other gods.
verses.ct: Do not forget the covenant I made with you. Do not fear other gods.

verses.kjv: But the LORD your God ye shall fear; and he shall deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.
verses.web: But you shall fear LORD your God, and he will deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.”
verses.ct: Fear the LORD your God, and he will rescue you from the power of all your enemies."

verses.kjv: Howbeit they did not hearken, but they did after their former manner.
verses.web: However they didn’t listen, but they did what they did before.
verses.ct: But they wouldn't listen. They just kept doing what they had always done.

verses.kjv: So these nations feared the LORD, and served their graven images, both their children, and their children’s children: as did their fathers, so do they unto this day.
verses.web: So these nations feared LORD, and also served their engraved images. Their children did likewise, and so did their children’s children. They do as their fathers did to this day.
verses.ct: So these nations feared the LORD while also serving their carved idols. Their children and grandchildren did the same thing. To this day, they continue doing exactly what their ancestors did.
